description: This course is an overview of Neo-Daoist philosophy (Xuanxue玄学), which marked a renewed interest in Daoism during Wei and Jin dynasties. It is dominantly a philosophical overview, but also touches on the religious aspects which cannot be removed from the character of the movement. It is an exploration of the new concepts articulated by these thinkers, but also of the emerging commentarial tradition, which was integral to the development of Chinese philosophy.
title: Readings in Neo-Daoism
prerequisite: YCC1113 Philosophy and Political Thought 1 and YCC1114 Philosophy and Political Thought 2 or with the permission from the instructor.
